content.description:
Sit start low on with hands on the  "climber's left" side of the arete and work your way up the arete feature.

 You can safely and easily exit left on the first ledge about 7 feet off the ground.  No need to top out all 25 feet if you are not super confident. 

 Fantastic movement for a V0 and a great introduction to high balls.  It's basically 3 stacked problems that each end with a no-hands-rest on a good ledge.
content.location: Obvious arete on the left end of a 25 foot cliff maybe 200 feet uphill of the white trail. It's just about 100 feet above the "nostril boulder" which is shortly  before "neon pit stain" when heading west on the white trail.

content.description:
Tall west facing face. 

youtube.com/watch?v=14hKDYo…
content.location: along trail west of campground headed towards visitor center.

content.description: Mini version of Walk into The Sky. Start on boulder to the right of Walk into The Sky, next to the Gateway Trail. Sit start low and work your way through jugs to the high topout
content.location: Boulder next to Walk into The Sky (Gateway Trail)

content.description: Same face as Walk Into This Guy but just left of it. Sit start on good finger buckets and move straight up.
content.location: Sit start with two good finger buckets and a right heel hook.

content.description: Start as low as you can with hands on both aretes. Make one move to a jug and top out. Great for beginners.
content.location: Head west on the Gateway Trail from Neon Cave and Nostril Boulder a short distance, look down the hill to the creek and you should see the tiny Pebble Boulder.

content.description: Only crux is the top out. A small crimp on the top right hand will help you pull up.
content.location: Left of Purple People Hater on the face of the rock

content.description: Start on a jug rail under the lip, pull onto the lip, throw some hooks and traverse left to the top out.
content.location: Downstream from the Walk into the Sky boulder.

content.description:
Start deep and low under the roof and work your way up the obvious arete.  The moves are fun and satisfying for the grade. 

 We did a lot of of thorn clearing after one stabbed me deep in my right nostril.  Hit me up if it already had a name.
content.location: It's a small boulder with an obvious juggy arete.  Lets call it the "nostril" boulder for now. Heading east on the white trail toward "Into the Sky" this will be uphill maybe 100 feet on your left shortly before you hit the "Pit Stain" boulder.  It's also about 100 feet below "Wing Zero" Boulder.

content.description: Start on a bomber crimp just under the roof, further down the lip than Streamlined. Work a fun beta to the lip and traverse into Stremlined and top out. I'm noting this because the beta that I worked added 5-6 feet of traversing to the original Streamlined.https://youtu.be/pprzc56iFkU
Sit start on a low horizontal crack, follow the plentiful features to the top.
content.location: Just up the hill directly between Neon Pit Stain and Walk Into The Sky.  On the face left of "The Other Squirrel" and "Squirrel Next Door" and right of "Roller Derby".

content.description: Sit start on side pull, move up through good holds and unlock the tricky topout that isn't as bad as it first looks
content.location: On the warmup wall, just above the Gateway Trail and Walk into the Sky

content.description: Start with two hands in a lower horizontal crack along the face.  Move up, firm your feet, and launch for the large horizontal jug overhead.  Top out above the overhanging lip to finish.  Left side crack and adjacent wall are off!
content.location: Just up the hill directly between Neon Pit Stain and Walk Into The Sky.  Visible from the path below- it's another exposed rock formation above the lower Gateway Trail.

content.description: Move up on the holds between the two boulder faces. Top out with a foot on the right. A little mossy in spots
content.location: Above the lower gateway trail on the "warmup wall" (although only one other problem called it this). Runs parallel to a trail with black blazes (lower gateway trail has white). To the immediate left of Squirrel next door and right of squirrelpool.

content.description: Start mega low on the large horizontal edge just above the ground.  Figure out the tricky foot beta to get started and off the forest floor, then get yourself up to the large holds overhead.  Use the crack to the right and/or the horizontal rail to the left to pull yourself vertical- then top out through easy jugs above!
content.location: Just to the left of Squirrel Next Door along the adjoining rock wall running parallel to the trail below.

content.description: One eyed, one horned, flying purple people hater! Start on large hold around waist high, move up through tiny crimps or reach past to horizontal crack and top out. Can go straight up or veer slightly left, both the same grade.
content.location: Just left of the squirrel climbs, on the wall above Walk into the Sky

content.description: No crux, Just a fun beginner climb! Climb the route with the obvious holds along the way!
content.location: Left of the Squirrel Boulder in the crack, where the rock begins to jut out

content.description: Variation of Squirrel Next Door.  Start with two hands in a lower horizontal crack along the face.  Move up, firm your feet, and launch for the large horizontal jug overhead.  Now move right and work your way around the arete.  Get over the top just to the left of the tree.  Left side crack and adjacent wall are off!
content.location: Just up the hill directly between Neon Pit Stain and Walk Into The Sky.  Visible from the path below- it's another exposed rock formation above the lower Gateway Trail.

content.description: Climb straight up the obvious crack to the small roof. Pull the roof and go straight up to the top. Getting over the roof is the crux.  Very chill after that but the height is considerable.  We actually brought out a tape measure to confirm it's ~25 feet.
content.location: Facing the "Wing Zero Cliff" this is the vertical crack on the left about 5 feet before the arete.  The cliff is located about 200 feet uphill of the white trail.  heading west this is before "neon pit stain"

content.description: Start below the low roof, reach out to the lip and move up. Continue up and slightly left, sharing a top out with Stabbed in the Nostril
content.location: On the Nostril boulder, just up the hill from the Gateway Trail and just before the Neon Boulder

content.description: Start low on an obvious sidecling jug-crimp. Move up left to a small but good crimp, set up and dyno to a flat slot a few feet further up. Proceed up leftward on good incut crimps into jugs. Topout left close to where the other rock outcropping converges with the main face. The topout is a bit overgrown, but please do not remove the moss along the top part of the face!If any information about this route can be improved upon, please let me know, and please give this problem a go and suggest a grade!
content.protection: More than 2 pads and spotters. Be sure to pad landing for the dynamic move well. Cleaning the climb on a rope is helpful.
content.location: The problem farthest left on the main face of the Gateway Trail Boulders. Left of Walk Into The Sky.

content.description: youtube.com/watch?v=14hKDYo…
content.location: 20 yards past Walk Into The Sky boulder headed west toward visitor center

content.description: Sit start on the jug used for the heel hook on Neon Pit Stains, go straight up, continuing to the top out, instead of going left like Neon Lemonade
content.location: On Neon Boulder

content.description: sit start on the jug used for the heel hook on Neon Pit Stains, go straight up to next jug, then shoot out left to link into neon pit stains and finish neon pit stains
content.location: on Neon Boulder

content.description: Sit start on the arete at the back of the cave and traverse to the same top out as Neon Milk.
content.location: On Neon Boulder

content.description: Sit-start on the obvious jug hooking out from the right.  Hands left to the sloping cracks, then move directly up through crimps and pockets to the landing midway up the face.  Exit to the right for an easy walk-off.
content.location: Up the hillside and parallel to the Gateway Trail below.  Part of the various collection of hillside features.  Has a large, flat, stepped formation that is seat-level just to the right of the start.  Great, flat landing in a small clearing below the problem.

content.description: Pretty classic left to right traverse staying primarily on the upper portion of the rim. It is worth doing for a warmup or cool down burn if nothing else. The rock quality is fantastic for the first 15ft. I dropped down low immediately before crossing the last outside corner and topped out on milk jug handles.It's for sure been done many times before and if someone has clever suggestion I'll rename it. Also, unlikely anyone knows who has the FA, but I will credit if someone has any info.Beta: Fun slopers in the 1st 10ft. The crux is dropping low just before the inside corner, moving off the slopers and transitioning through the inside corner....then it's mostly jugs and finger buckets the rest of the way. Fun V0, maybe V1 at crux. Give it a try and put up your grade/opinion.
content.protection: A few pads not bad idea at the crux. Low enough and friendly enough though that pads not essential.
content.location: Hike up towards the top of the ridge well above WITS (300-400 ft) passing at least two other broken outcrops (with problems).This one starts on jugs to the far left side of the same boulder as the two Jungle Gym problems, 4ft left of the obvious outside corner.

content.description: Start on the obvious jug about waist high, throw a heel to start and have fun pulling through jugs to an easy top out
content.location: Directly uphill from half pint - right off of the Crows nest trail, problems face away from trail(39.62196, -77.43272)

content.description: Start on 2 decent crimps and pull up through a juggy topout
content.location: directly left of Jungle Gym Right

content.description: Start on the obvious bulge in the middle of the seam, traverse right along the seam until it meets the vertical crack, pull up through a good jug to an insecure crimp and top out, the large block on the ground by the finish is off
content.location: Uphill and left of the warm up wall (squirrel climbs), and directly left of Flocka Wocka Crack Birds, the boulder with the small cave underneath(~39.62183, -77.43280)

content.description: Sit start on two crimps, use left hand bump to move to a hole in the roof. Match the hold then make a left hand move to a small crimp. Make a big move with your right hand up to a good hold. Use bad sloapy holds at the top to mantle and top out. Video beta: youtu.be/bnrjkUj6Pzs
content.protection: Pads are sufficient but spotter never hurts
content.location: On the jungle gym boulder, left of the jungle gym climbs. Boulder directly off of crows nest trail, climbs face away from trail, same as Groaner

content.description: Start on a good jug in the corner, drop down into a slot crimp traverse across to a good sloper, pull up and work out the tough topout
content.location: On the jungle gym boulder, left of the jungle gym climbs. Boulder directly off of crows nest trail, climbs face away from trail.

content.description: Start on the far left side of the obvious seam around the lip of the cave, split hands and a good heel in a sloper, traverse the seam using heels and decent hands into the start of half pint, make the transition into half pint and finish out. Large block on the ground near the finish is off
content.location: On the pint boulder, left of Wocka Flocka Crack birds.

content.description: Sit start on a decent rail, move directly up through rails and other features to top out.
content.location: Start on the ledge directly to the right of Flocka Wocka Crack Birds and Chonk Chonk Bird.

content.description: Follow obvious crack, layback your way up the short route
content.location: Just up and left of the Squirrel Boulder, which is just above Walk into the Sky.

content.description: Sit Start extension to Walk into the Sky.   Start low and way left on decent crimps.  Traverse low and right across the face on the obvious line of crimps into the starting jugs of Walk into the Sky, then climb the OG line.
Start on an obvious jug and move up using only holds on the large angled block.
content.location: Directly to the right of Flocka Wocka Crack Birds

content.description: Sit-start in the cave on obvious jug.  Reach up directly overhead, work your way to the right.  Reach out for the lip, then use only the lower and leading edge of the rim and move to crimps and jugs on the face.  Power your way over the top to finish.  Large vertical slab underneath is off.
content.location: Cave just to the right of Neon Pit Stain and related problems.

content.description: Start in the large horizontal break and climb sharp crimps up the wall just to the right of Walk into the Sky.
content.protection: Many pads and spotter.  The boulder is tall and the landing is uneven.
content.location: See photo.

content.description:
The Gateway Boulders are a series of low faces, prows, and boulders along the Gateway Trail of Catoctin Mountain Park. 

  Most of the climbs are low enough to be considered boulder problems, with overhangs and slab faces constituting the majority of the terrain.  Many rocks and seemingly obvious lines exist here with few recorded ascents.
